org.jcvi.jillion.core.util

Class GenomeStatistics

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.core.util.GenomeStatistics

  • public final class GenomeStatistics
extends Object
    GenomeStatistics is a utility class for computing different statistical measurements about genomes (for example N50).
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder
      Interface for computing a Genome Statistic using the Builder pattern which allows you to delay adding elements to include in the computation instead of requiring them all at once.

    • Method Detail

      • nX

        public static OptionalInt nX(IntStream stream,
                             double percentage)
        Create and execute a Collector that will compute the Nx value of the elements in the given stream. The end result is the same as creating a GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder via nXBuilder(double) and then manually adding each element to the stream to the builder then returning the resulting built OptionalInt. However, since this uses the new Stream and Collector classes, it may have better performance if using a parallel stream.
        API Note:
        the reason this method exists is because Java 8 collectors on primitives doesn't have a catch all collect(Collector) method like the object Stream does. In order save users from manually creating collectors themselves, it was easier to create a helper method that creates the collector then executes it.
        Parameters:
        stream - the IntStream of elements to compute; can not be null.
        percentage - the percentage value to compute; must be between 0 and 1 exclusive. For example to compute N50, the percentage value is 0.5.
        Returns:
        an OptionalInt which either has a value, or is empty if there was an error computing it.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either stream or mapper are null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if percentage ≥ 1 or ≤ 0.

      • nX

        public static OptionalInt nX(LongStream stream,
                             double percentage)
        Create and execute a Collector that will compute the Nx value of the elements in the given stream. The end result is the same as creating a GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder via nXBuilder(double) and then manually adding each element to the stream to the builder then returning the resulting built OptionalInt. However, since this uses the new Stream and Collector classes, it may have better performance if using a parallel stream.
        API Note:

        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either stream or mapper are null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if percentage ≥ 1 or ≤ 0.

      • n50

        public static OptionalInt n50(IntStream stream)
        Compute the N50 value of the elements in the given IntStream. The end result is the same as creating a GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder via n50Builder() and then manually adding each element to the stream to the builder then returning the resulting built OptionalInt. However, since this uses the new Stream and Collector classes, it may have better performance if using a parallel stream.
        API Note:
        the reason this method exists is because Java 8 collectors on primitives doesn't have a catch all collect(Collector) method like the object Stream does. In order save users from manually creating collectors themselves, it was easier to create a helper method that creates the collector then executes it.
        Implementation Note:
        This is the same as nX(stream, .5D)
        Parameters:
        stream - the IntStream of elements to compute; can not be null.
        Returns:
        an OptionalInt which either has a value, or is empty if there was an error computing it.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if stream is null.

      • ngX

        public static OptionalInt ngX(LongStream stream,
                              double percentage,
                              long genomeLength)
        Create and execute a Collector that will compute the NGx value of the elements in the given stream. The end result is the same as creating a GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder via ngXBuilder(long, double) and then manually adding each element to the stream to the builder then returning the resulting built OptionalInt. However, since this uses the new Stream and Collector classes, it may have better performance if using a parallel stream.
        API Note:
        the reason this method exists is because Java 8 collectors on primitives doesn't have a catch all collect(Collector) method like the object Stream does. In order save users from manually creating collectors themselves, it was easier to create a helper method that creates the collector then executes it.
        Parameters:
        stream - the LongStream of elements to compute; can not be null.
        percentage - the percentage value to compute; must be between 0 and 1 exclusive. For example to compute N50, the percentage value is 0.5.
        genomeLength - the (expected) genome length which is used to determine when we have X% covered.
        Returns:
        an OptionalInt which either has a value, or is empty if there was an error computing it.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either stream is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if genomeLength < 1 or percentage ≥ 1 or ≤ 0.

      • ngX

        public static OptionalInt ngX(IntStream stream,
                              double percentage,
                              long genomeLength)
        Create and execute a Collector that will compute the NGx value of the elements in the given stream. The end result is the same as creating a GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder via ngXBuilder(long, double) and then manually adding each element to the stream to the builder then returning the resulting built OptionalInt. However, since this uses the new Stream and Collector classes, it may have better performance if using a parallel stream.
        API Note:
        the reason this method exists is because Java 8 collectors on primitives doesn't have a catch all collect(Collector) method like the object Stream does. In order save users from manually creating collectors themselves, it was easier to create a helper method that creates the collector then executes it.
        Parameters:
        stream - the LongStream of elements to compute; can not be null.
        percentage - the percentage value to compute; must be between 0 and 1 exclusive. For example to compute N50, the percentage value is 0.5.
        genomeLength - the (expected) genome length which is used to determine when we have X% covered.
        Returns:
        an OptionalInt which either has a value, or is empty if there was an error computing it.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either stream is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if genomeLength < 1 or percentage ≥ 1 or ≤ 0.

      • ng50

        public static OptionalInt ng50(IntStream stream,
                               long genomeLength)
        Compute the NG50 value of the elements in the given IntStream. The end result is the same as creating a GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder via ng50Builder(long) and then manually adding each element to the stream to the builder then returning the resulting built OptionalInt. However, since this uses the new Stream and Collector classes, it may have better performance if using a parallel stream.
        API Note:
        the reason this method exists is because Java 8 collectors on primitives doesn't have a catch all collect(Collector) method like the object Stream does. In order save users from manually creating collectors themselves, it was easier to create a helper method that creates the collector then executes it.
        Implementation Note:
        This is the same as ngX(stream, .5D, genomeLength)
        Parameters:
        stream - the IntStream of elements to compute; can not be null.
        genomeLength - the (expected) genome length which is used to determine when we have X% covered.
        Returns:
        an OptionalInt which either has a value, or is empty if there was an error computing it.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if stream is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if genomeLength < 1.

      • n50Builder

        public static GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder n50Builder()
        Helper method for Creating a GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder that will compute N50. This is equivalent to calling nxBuilder(0.5D)
        Returns:
        a new GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder instance to add the contig lengths to.
        See Also:
        nXBuilder(double)

      • n75Builder

        public static GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder n75Builder()
        Helper method for Creating a GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder that will compute N75. This is equivalent to calling nxBuilder(0.75D)
        Returns:
        a new GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder instance to add the contig lengths to.
        See Also:
        nXBuilder(double)

        public static GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder n90Builder()

        See Also:
        nXBuilder(double)

      • nXBuilder

        public static GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder nXBuilder(double percentage)
        Creates a new GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder instance that will compute the Nx value for any percentage. For example to compute N50, the percentage value is 0.5.
        Parameters:
        percentage - the percentage value to compute; must be between 0 and 1 exclusive. For example to compute N50, the percentage value is 0.5.
        Returns:
        a new GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder instance to add the contig lengths to.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if percentage >= 1 or <= 0.

      • ng50Builder

        public static GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder ng50Builder(long genomeLength)
        Helper method for Creating a GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder that will compute NG50. This is equivalent to calling nxBuilder(genomeLength, 0.5D)
        Parameters:
        genomeLength - the (expected) genome length which is used to determine when we have 50% covered.
        Returns:
        a new GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder instance to add the contig lengths to.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if genomeLength < 1
        See Also:
        ngXBuilder(long, double)

      • ngXBuilder

        public static GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder ngXBuilder(long genomeLength,
                                                                  double percentage)
        Creates a new GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder instance that will compute the NGx value for any percentage. For example to compute NG50, the percentage value is 0.5.
        Parameters:
        genomeLength - the (expected) genome length which is used to determine when we have X% covered.
        percentage - the percentage value to compute; must be between 0 and 1 exclusive. For example to compute N50, the percentage value is 0.5.
        Returns:
        a new GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder instance to add the contig lengths to.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if genomeLength < 1 or percentage >= 1 or percentage <= 0.

      • ng50Collector

        public static <T extends Number> Collector<T,GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder,OptionalInt> ng50Collector(long genomeLength)
        Collect all the elements of a Stream of Numbers and compute the NG50 value. The end result is the same as creating a GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder via ng50Builder(long) and then manually adding each element of the stream to the builder then returning the resulting built OptionalInt. However, since this uses the new Stream and Collector classes, it may have better performance if using a parallel stream.
        Implementation Note:
        This is the same as ngX(genomeLength, .5D)
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of Number to be collected (usually ints or longs)
        Parameters:
        genomeLength - the (expected) genome length which is used to determine when we have X% covered.
        Returns:
        an OptionalInt which either has a value, or is empty if there was an error computing it.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if genomeLength < 1.

      • ng90Collector

        public static <T extends Number> Collector<T,GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder,OptionalInt> ng90Collector(long genomeLength)
        Collect all the elements of a Stream of Numbers and compute the NG90 value. The end result is the same as creating a GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder via ng90Builder(long) and then manually adding each element of the stream to the builder then returning the resulting built OptionalInt. However, since this uses the new Stream and Collector classes, it may have better performance if using a parallel stream.
        Implementation Note:
        This is the same as ngX(genomeLength, .9D)
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of Number to be collected (usually ints or longs)
        Parameters:
        genomeLength - the (expected) genome length which is used to determine when we have X% covered.
        Returns:
        an OptionalInt which either has a value, or is empty if there was an error computing it.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if genomeLength < 1.

      • ng75Collector

        public static <T extends Number> Collector<T,GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder,OptionalInt> ng75Collector(long genomeLength)
        Collect all the elements of a Stream of Numbers and compute the NG75 value. The end result is the same as creating a GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder via ng75Builder(long) and then manually adding each element of the stream to the builder then returning the resulting built OptionalInt. However, since this uses the new Stream and Collector classes, it may have better performance if using a parallel stream.
        Implementation Note:
        This is the same as ngX(genomeLength, .75D)
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of Number to be collected (usually ints or longs)
        Parameters:
        genomeLength - the (expected) genome length which is used to determine when we have X% covered.
        Returns:
        an OptionalInt which either has a value, or is empty if there was an error computing it.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if genomeLength < 1.

      • ngXCollector

        public static <T extends Number> Collector<T,GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder,OptionalInt> ngXCollector(long genomeLength,
                                                                                                                double percentage)
        Collect all the elements of a Stream of Numbers and compute the NGx value for any percentage. For example to compute NG50, the percentage value is 0.5. The end result is the same as creating a GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder via ngXBuilder(long, double) and then manually adding each element of the stream to the builder then returning the resulting built OptionalInt. However, since this uses the new Stream and Collector classes, it may have better performance if using a parallel stream.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of Number to be collected (usually ints or longs)
        Parameters:
        genomeLength - the (expected) genome length which is used to determine when we have X% covered.
        percentage - the percentage value to compute; must be between 0 and 1 exclusive. For example to compute N50, the percentage value is 0.5.
        Returns:
        an OptionalInt which either has a value, or is empty if there was an error computing it.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if genomeLength < 1 or percentage ≥ 1 or percentage ≤ 0.

      • n50Collector

        public static <T extends Number> Collector<T,GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder,OptionalInt> n50Collector()
        Collect all the elements of a Stream of Numbers and compute the N50 value. The end result is the same as creating a GenomeStatistics.GenomeStatisticsBuilder via n50Builder() and then manually adding each element of the stream to the builder then returning the resulting built OptionalInt. However, since this uses the new Stream and Collector classes, it may have better performance if using a parallel stream.
        Implementation Note:
        This is the same as ngX(.5D)
        Type Parameters:

        Returns:
        an OptionalInt which either has a value, or is empty if there was an error computing it.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if genomeLength < 1.
